description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5395f","text":"Selective purification of early endosomes can be achieved through affinity capture of the early endosome-associated protein EEA1 (termed Endo-IP) (Park et al. 2022).  These purified endosomes can be used for proteomic and lipidomic studies to obtain snapshots of early endosomes.  Here, we present an immunofluorescence protocol to assess the extent of colocalization between FLAG-EEA1 and RAB5 with and without the Dynamin-1 and -2 (DNM1/2) inhibitor Dyngo4a.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhg85","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lu7q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"9A6FB12B17E911ECBDAA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"9A6FB0D717E911ECBDAA0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

fork_info.title: Immunofluorescence of RAB5 and FLAG-EEA1 puncta after Dynamin-1 and -2 inhibition with Dyngo4a

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c43ak","text":"Coat No.1.5 coverslips in 0.01% poly-L-lysine solution.  Incubate at    for   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":69,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":76,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bcm7s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"7F567E8017E411ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"49404","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"5AF3EB4017E411ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"80085","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5req9","text":"Aspirate poly-L-lysine solution and wash coverslips three times with sterile DPBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4o4uf","text":"Split 293EL cells expressing 3XFLAG-EEA1 (see protocol dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.byi7puhn) by standard methods and seed onto the prepared coverslips such that they will be approximately 70% confluent the next day.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":9,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"frats","text":"The next day, check that cells are approximately 70% confluent.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"44kgc","text":"Dilute DMSO (for control) and Dyngo4a (treatment) into warmed serum-free DMEM to a final concentration of 0.4% DMSO and   Dyngo4a.  Note: if using   Dyngo4a stocks in DMSO, the final concentration DMSO in both control and treated samples will be 0.4%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":120,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":147,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"d7tb6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7isa2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ajnml","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"aq8nm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"22iqe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"20","error_concentration":false,"guid":"A205C70017E511ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"9028","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":29}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"CA0EF41017E511ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"9029","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d5t3i","text":"Protect Dyngo4a from light, and thaw just before use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bj0sq","text":"The exact dose of Dyngo4a and length of treatment will vary by cell line.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7hana","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dj34p","text":"Aspirate existing media from cells growing on coverslips, and add new media containing either DMSO or Dyngo4a.  Return cells to incubator for   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":142,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"fqnq9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":10800,"guid":"F2F317D017E511ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"80087","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7euhc","text":"After treatment, neutralize Dyngo4a by aspirating DMSO or Dyngo4a media and washing cells once with DMEM with 10% serum and 0.4% DMSO.  Wash cells once with DPBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26q97","text":"Fix cells in 4% paraformaldehyde solution in DPBS for   at   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":59,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9qb4t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"6A9AA78017E611ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"80088","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"6ECBF52017E611ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"49407","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"25","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aj2gq","text":"Wash samples three times in DPBS.  Block samples for   at   in blocking buffer (1% BSA, 0.15% Triton X-100, DPBS).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":53,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":58,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"36m0o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"82AE984017E611ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"80089","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8577071017E611ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"49408","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"25","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7in97","text":"Remove blocking solution, and incubate samples in primary antibody solution [anti-RAB5 (Cell Signaling Technology, 3547) at 1:200 and anti-DYKDDDDK (Thermo Fisher Scientific, MA1-91878, which detects the FLAG epitope)  at 1:200 in blocking solution]   at   .  Include single primary antibody controls and no primary antibody controls.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":250,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":255,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"etsiu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"F3C3DFE017E611ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"80090","label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F6EB108017E611ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"49409","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bac5v","text":"The next day, remove the primary antibody solution, wash samples three times with blocking solution, and incubate in secondary antibody solution [Goat-anti-Rabbit-594 (Thermo Fisher Scientific, A-11012) at 1:400 and Goat-anti-Mouse-488 (Thermo Fisher Scientific, A-11029) at 1:400] for   at    protected from light. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":286,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":291,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c713u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":3600,"guid":"24E38EE017E711ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"80091","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"28928D2017E711ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"49410","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"25","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ujna","text":"Stain samples with Hoechst 33342 1.25 Âµg/mL in DBPS for   at    protected from light.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":61,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"eusgq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"20397CE017E911ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"80092","label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"2357D3E017E911ECA92285F46D4BDBAD","id":"49411","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"25","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5fmu6","text":"Wash samples three times with DPBS, then mount coverslips on slides with ProLong Glass Antifade Mountant and seal with clear nail polish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bep1l","text":"Image samples on a confocal microscope at 100x magnification with an oil objective.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"erbl7","text":"Calculate Manderâ€™s correlation coefficients with JACoP plugin in Fiji to assess the colocalization of signals from two channels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Immunofluorescence of GM2
